intro: Teucrium aristatum, commonly known as the upright germander, is a perennial herb native to southern Europe and parts of North Africa. It typically grows to a height of about 30–60 centimeters and features opposite, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are usually pink or purple, arranged in dense spikes at the ends of the stems. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or dry habitats. Teucrium aristatum is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes used in traditional herbal medicine.
